etymology.description: 蒙(蒙) (méng, "Mongol; cover; ignorant"), 特(特) (tè, "special"), 利(利) (lì, "sharp; profit"), 尔(爾) (ěr, "you")
etymology.interpretation: This word is a phonetic approximation of the English name 'Montreal.' Each character is chosen primarily for its sound rather than its meaning, a common practice in transcribing foreign names into Chinese.

examples.chinese: 我计划今年夏天去蒙特利尔(蒙特利爾)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jìhuà jīnnián xiàtiān qù Méngtèlì'ěr.
examples.english: I plan to go to Montreal this summer.

examples.chinese: 我听说蒙特利尔有丰富的文化(我聽說蒙特利爾有豐富的文化)，风景也十分迷人(風景也十分迷人)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ tīngshuō Méngtèlì'ěr yǒu fēngfù de wénhuà, fēngjǐng yě shífēn mírén.
examples.english: I heard that Montreal has a rich culture, and its scenery is very charming.
